channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: 469 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore, including 2 in the community and 15 imported
item.description:
July 27, 2020 3:51 PM

The imported cases had been placed on stay-home notices upon arrival in Singapore.

item.title: Lawyer Samuel Seow pleads guilty to assaulting another lawyer, using criminal force on subordinate
item.description:
July 27, 2020 3:42 PM

Seow prodded the forehead of one of his subordinates twice with his finger and caused her pain, in an incident that took place at his law firm in 2018.

item.title: SPH scholarships: From covering the coronavirus to paying it forward, recipients take on a changed world
item.description:
July 27, 2020 3:15 PM

SINGAPORE - Mr Wong Yang, one of two recipients of the Singapore Press Holdings (SPH) journalism scholarship this year, earned his stripes as a greenhorn journalist covering an unprecedented pandemic.

item.title: Retired actor Ng Aik Leong tells court Bangladeshi worker he allegedly hit gave him 'right' to 'hammer him'
item.description:
July 27, 2020 2:30 PM

Ng, better known as Huang Yiliang, caused injury to the victim's scalp, as well as an abrasion on his upper abdomen

item.title: Controlling director fined $25k, ordered to pay $955,580 penalty for declaring incorrect expenses of directors' fees
item.description:
July 27, 2020 1:50 PM

SINGAPORE - A company's controlling director was fined $25,000 and ordered to pay a penalty of $955,580 on Monday (July 27) for declaring incorrect expenses of directors' fees in corporate income tax returns.

item.title: SingPost to launch 2 Singapore-themed stamp sets on local mascots and traits
item.description:
July 27, 2020 12:53 PM

SINGAPORE - SingPost will be launch two new stamp sets featuring local mascots and everyday lingo in the first week of August.

item.title: NTU researchers develop method to tell if someone has Covid-19 or dengue in just 36 minutes
item.description:
July 27, 2020 11:07 AM

This is just one quarter of the time taken by current testing methods for the same diseases.

item.title: Winners of Youth Action Challenge summit get $50k grant to carry out initiatives to address societal problems
item.description:
July 27, 2020 10:14 AM

SINGAPORE - To help young Singaporeans make informed career and future education choices regardless of background, youth-led non-profit organisation Advisory has devised several initiatives to bring resources to the youth.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on July 27
Singapore, France ink treaty on mutual legal aid to fight crime
item.description:
July 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore and France have secured cooperation in the prevention and suppression of crime, with both parties signing a mutual legal assistance treaty at a virtual ceremony last Wednesday.

item.title: Why dengue cases are exploding in Singapore
item.description:
July 27, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 20,000 infections have been recorded in less than seven months of this year.

item.title: Woman charged with murdering daughter insisted on raising her single-handedly: Brother-in-law
item.description:
July 27, 2020 5:00 AM

A 24-year-old woman, who was charged with the murder of her four-year-old daughter, insisted on raising the child on her own after her divorce and then broke off contact with both her family and that of her former husband, said her brother-in-law.

item.title: Adapting to the new normal
item.description:
July 27, 2020 5:00 AM

It was Dec 30, 2019. I had my last clinic session of the year and patients who came were eager to share their plans and hopes for the coming year.

item.title: Fruit of their labour lost to garden thieves
item.description:
July 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Growing some fruit and veg for the kitchen table is hard enough what with pesky insects and pests, but community gardeners have an even more infuriating foe to contend with - thieves snitching produce and digging up entire plants.

item.title: New strain a key factor behind worst dengue outbreak
item.description:
July 27, 2020 5:00 AM

A confluence of factors is contributing to Singapore's worst dengue outbreak.

item.title: Bicycle-sharing firm Anywheel gets nod to expand fleet to 15,000
item.description:
July 27, 2020 5:00 AM

The shared bike population in Singapore will be expanding, after local bicycle-sharing firm Anywheel received approval from the Land Transport Authority (LTA) to expand its fleet from 10,000 to 15,000 with effect from this month.

item.title: National Day Parade to have just around 150 spectators
item.description:
July 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Instead of the tens of thousands of spectators in past years, this year's National Day Parade (NDP) will have just around 150 spectators who are "representatives of society", said Defence Minister Ng Eng Hen yesterday.

item.title: Digital day out with animals up for adoption
item.description:
July 27, 2020 5:00 AM

The National Parks Board's (NParks) monthly Pets' Day Out event returned in digital format for the second time on Saturday.

item.title: Special salute for nurses and others on front line in fight against coronavirus
item.description:
July 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Military Expert 2 (ME2) Muhammad Khairunnizam Amran's decade-long involvement in National Day Parades will be marked with a special one on Aug 9 that is being held during the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Sentencing of NUS student who tried to strangle ex-girlfriend sparks public debate
item.description:
July 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Legal experts say the public is often not privy to the many factors being weighed when a judge decides on a sentence.

item.title: Singapore and Malaysia finalise two cross-border travel schemes
item.description:
July 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore and Malaysia have finalised arrangements for long-term pass holders and travellers on essential or official business to cross the border - applications for which will kick off on Aug 10, Foreign Minister Vivian Balakrishnan announced yesterday.

item.title: Growing up with autism
item.description:
July 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Chan Yan Ling, 11, runs up and down the full length of the train platform while she, her sister Yan Yun, eight, and their domestic helper Musli wait for the MRT train on their way home after school.

item.title: Coronavirus: 4 in Bukit Panjang transport hub cluster are drivers
item.description:
July 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Four coronavirus patients linked to a cluster at Bukit Panjang Integrated Transport Hub are all bus drivers, said transport operator SMRT yesterday.

item.title: A-level 'straight C' student finds success in SMU after 3 gap years
item.description:
July 27, 2020 5:00 AM

By all accounts, Ms Lim Geok Shan is the quintessential academic overachiever, with a scholarship from the Singapore Management University (SMU) and a place on the dean's list for three years running from 2016.

item.title: Coronavirus: Baby among 4 new imported cases; five new infections in community
item.description:
July 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Two of the four new imported Covid-19 cases announced yesterday were a Singaporean and a permanent resident (PR) who returned to Singapore from Indonesia last Friday, the Ministry of Health (MOH) said.

item.title: Active volunteer driven by passion to help those in need
item.description:
July 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Growing up in a single-parent home can be tough on a child but fresh graduate Norullayaley Mohd Ikbal said she was never hard done, with extended family, friends and neighbours all lending a hand.

item.title: E-scooter rider ordered to pay $445k to woman severely hurt in accident
item.description:
July 27, 2020 5:00 AM

A man who caused severe brain injuries to a female pedestrian when he collided with her while riding an electric scooter in 2016 has been ordered to pay her damages of $445,000.

item.title: $4k fine for man who took bottles of sanitiser from lift
item.description:
July 27, 2020 5:00 AM

A man took home bottles of hand sanitiser placed inside a lift, which were meant for residents of a Bishan Housing Board block.

item.title: All set for school
item.description:
July 27, 2020 5:00 AM

A primary school pupil being dropped off at the Convent of the Holy Infant Jesus in Victoria Street on May 20, 1970. The school moved to Toa Payoh in 1984.

item.title: Ask The Experts: Treating rare heart disease ATTR-CM
